meanings.definition: Capable of being measured or assessed.
meanings.sent1: The length of the table was gageable with a ruler.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the suitcase was gageable on the scale.
meanings.sent3: The gageable distance to the store was just a short walk away.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was gageable, like a river flowing steadily.
meanings.sent5: The gageable temperature outside made it perfect for a picnic.

meanings.definition: Able to be used as collateral for a loan.
meanings.sent1: The valuable painting was gageable for a loan at the bank.
meanings.sent2: His car was gageable for the loan he needed to buy a new computer.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly offered her gageable collection of rubber ducks as collateral.
meanings.sent4: His reputation was gageable, like a safety net for the loan.
meanings.sent5: The gageable jewelry she owned was enough to secure the loan.
